knimeNode.name: Dose Response
knimeNode.shortDescription: Caclulates and visualizes dose repsonse curves

fullDescription.intro:
Caclulates and visualizes dose repsonse models. This is achieved by fitting several non-linear regression models to your data.
Measurements from a zero concentration are used to calculate the fit but are not displayed in the plot because of its logarithmic scale.
For a conceptutal and technical overview have a look at "Bioassay Analysis using R", Ritz and Streibig, 2005, 5:12, Journal of Statistical Software.
As this node is using R as backend, make sure that Rserve is running somewhere, and Knime is accordingly configured (Knime->Preferences).
fullDescription.option: The parameter fow which a dose response anaylis should be carried out.
A grouping attribute to group wells according to replicate or compound
The column which contains the concentrations
Adds a custom main title to the plot

The folloing models (referrerd to by their abbreviation in the configurioatn dialog) are supported:
LL.3 : Three-parameter logistic
LL.4 : Four-parameter logistic (default)
LL.5 : Five-parameter logistic
BC.5 : The Brain-Cousens hormesis models
W1.2 : Two-parameter Weibull
W1.3 : Three-parameter Weibull
W1.4 : Four-parameter Weibull

Allows to set constraints for some or all parameters of the model. This requires knowledge about the model structure, which can be obtained easily using R (e.g. just type ?LL.4 for the configuration of the 4-parametric logistic model. Use NA for no constraint.
Example for LL.4 which imposes a upper limit at 3: NA, NA, 3, NA

ports.inPort: A table with dose response data
ports.outPort: A table which contains ic50s, model parameters, and error estimates
